attributes.action: Persuade Whirlpool /Hotpoint to refund customers with fire hazard tumble dryers
attributes.additional_details: On the website we found our dryer was affected and were shown how to keep it clean.(Something we were doing anyway)We were told the engineer would visit in 5 weeks-we haven't used the dryer since-on fire service advice. It will now be months before we are allocated a visit. All winter then, damp house.The dryers are still catching fire, just google the news-even after being modified. Retailer is not interested - these dryers are not fit for purpose, we want our money back but no-one will listen.
attributes.background: Hotpoint, Indesit & Creda issued safety notices in November for a number of their tumble dryers. Customers were advised to register on their website-and were assured an engineer would visit in a matter of weeks for modifications to be made. Three months later we are still waiting for an appointment.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition as the UK Government and Parliament is not responsible for the decisions of Whirlpool/Hotpoint.

You could consider making a complaint to Trading Standards. You can find more information about making a report to Trading Standards here:

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/consumer/get-more-help/report-to-trading-standards/
